moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bc4 Bc5 4. c3: straightforward Italian so far, Blacks' next move is considered to be weak; better is Nf6, d4, exd4, cxd4, Bb4+, and take it from there...
moves.4... h6 5. O-O d6 6. d4 exd4 7. cxd4 Bb6: bold, but not the best of continuations; this will soon lose the game... best was d5, Nd4, Nbd2, Qf6, h3, and see where this ends...
moves.10. Bxf7+: the only thing, that could save White now, was Nbd2, Qf6, Rb1, sit and wait and pray; but I was blind...
moves.10... Kxf7 11. Ng5+: if we lose, we lose in grace and with a great bang; even Ne5+ was better; this will open up the h-file, much to my dismay...
moves.14. Qf4+: better is Qxe6, and try not to make more mistakes; but by now, I started to feel that Black didn't realize how winning he really had become at this moment...
moves.14... Nf6 15. Nc3 c6: certainly not the best: Qb3/Qc4 was to be preferrred...
moves.16. Rae1 Qe5 17. Qxe5 dxe5 18. Kh1: pure on speculation for other complications; Nc2 here, is a big problem... but hard to find...
moves.20. Re2: Rc1 was better, but Black seems oblivious...
moves.20... Ng4: a real pity; Nh5 was surely winning, threatening exf4...
moves.21. Bxd8: I confess: I totally missed Rxh2 and mate, running very low on time; lucky for me, Black had still no clue and even less time than me... plus my stunning looks, of course... ;)
moves.21... Rxd8 22. fxe5+ Ke6 23. Rxc2: getting lucky this time, coming back from a totally lost game; but this is blitz at its finest... anyway, Ne3 will still win some material...
moves.23... Nf2+: not sure what happened here: divine intervention? ghost vision? we will never know...
moves.24. Rcxf2 Bxf2 25. Rxf2: by now, Black must have realized what he has done; there is no mate on the bottom row...
moves.26... Kxe5 27. h3 Kd4 28. Kh2 Rxc3: winning my last pieces, but missing the point...
moves.30. e5: finally, it dawns on Black and he resigns; this is what I love about blitz...
